text: today we're trying to make sense of a
trip by a man named mohammad ismail to
London mr. Ismael is the right-hand man
to Saif al-islam gaddafi who is the son
of colonel qaddafi his trip follows the
defection of one of Colonel Gaddafi's
closest confidants Musa Kusa but this
appears not to be a defection according
to a friend of muhammad ismail in london
he arrived on official business and will
be returning to libya so the question
now is who sent him and what's his
mission he may have come on behalf of
the whole family it's also possible that
he was sent on behalf of Seif al-islam
alone it would seem logical that he had
been sent to try to propose some sort of
a truce or resolution of the conflict
here with the Western powers it's not
clear whether that proposal would
involve some sort of a handover of power
from Colonel Qaddafi or whether that
would mean a hand over to his son Seif
site for a long time has been the
foremost advocate of a transition to a
constitutional democracy of some kind
here in Libya but since the Civil War or
the revolution depending on your point
of view broke out he has been absolutely
lockstep with his father in terms of
vowing swift and stern retribution
against the rebels in the east it's also
not clear whether the West will approach
this as a subject for negotiation
between the Western powers France
Britain in the US on one side and
Qaddafi on the other in the eyes of the
West this is a revolution a democracy
movement led by the people in eastern
Libya so the negotiations to resolve the
impasse should take place between the
people in each of Libya and the Qaddafi
government
you
